p: Fungal endocarditis (FE) is a rare infection, accounting for <2% of Infective endocarditis (IE) ( 1– 4), which is usually caused by Candida ( 5– 7). A. flavus is a kind of Aspergillus. Although there were some reports of Aspergillus endocarditis (AE) in hemodialysis patients, the reports of IE caused by A. flavus are rare ( 8, 9). To the best of our knowledge, this is the first reported case employing mNGS to diagnose A. flavus caused IE in a patient with long term hemodialysis.
